original: FELLENIUS, Wolmar Knut Axel, Professor em, överstelöjtn, Stockholm, f Salem, Sthlms l, 10/9 76 av major A R W F o Eveline Kuhlau, gm Emy Janse. Mog.ex NReal Sthlm 94, KTH (V o V) 94—98. Milit.kurs f intr i VVK 98, ljt VVK 04, kapt 13, major 20, öv.löjtn 30. Avd.ing v statsban Gällivare—Riksgränsen 99, l:e bitr ing v Norrkps stads byggn.kont 99—03, arb.ch o stadsbyggmäst i Hsand 03—05, avd.ch v Gbgs hamnstyr :s nybyggn.avd 05—11, lär i väg- o vattenbyggn.konst CTL 06—11, prof i vattenbyggn.lära KTH 11-42. Krigstjg 14, 39, 40 o fr 41. Upprätt förslag t hamnbyggn f Gbg, Västerås, Falkenb, Kristineh, Jönköping, Södertälje, Oskarshamn, Örnsköldsvik, Halmst, Hälsingborg, Gävle, Varberg, Lkrona, Trondheim, Oslo mfl samt bitr v fi av dessa förslags utför; projekt o övervak utför av pontonbro öv Tranebergssund (tills m prof O Linton 13), verkst utredn ang flytbro öv L:a Värtan (tills m d:o). Led av kommiss f statsban Rönninge—Ström 11, av SJ:s geotekn kommiss, ds ordf 19—22 o ordf i ds arb.utsk 14—22. Förest KTH :s avd f väg- o vatten-byggn.konst 15—28 o 39—42, ordf KTH:s bibl.-nmd 33—42. Sekr Sv Kommunaltekn Frn 08 —12, hed.led där 33, hed.borg v tekn högsk Karlsruhe 21, korresp led av Norsk Ingeni0rs-forening 24, Dr-ing h c tekn högsk Darmstadt 36, styr.led Sv Tekn.frn 23—25, 28—29 o 31— 36, ordf i dess avd f tekn underv 23—25 o 33 —36, f väg- o vattenb.konst 26—27, ordf i Johannesavd av Sthlms Fastigh.ägarefrn sed. 35, v. ordf i dna frns fullmakt sed. 37, led av hyresnmdn f Sthlms 5:e distr sed. 42, studieråd v Tekn Inst Sthlm sed. 16, ordf i Frn 1876 års män sed. 31. Av trycket: Fiskhamnar vid o i närheten av Nordsjön (07), Frihamnar i Europa, Om beräkn av kaj-byggn o dyl (10), Nybyggn i Gbgs hamn (12), Hamnväs :s utveckling i Sv under den sen 50-årsperioden (12), Försl t frihamn i ’Gbg (15), Utredn av erosionsrisker gm partiell regl av Siljan (tills m L von Post 22), Ekon beräkn av pumpledningar (13), Vatten-byggn.lab v KTH (19, 22, 26, 29), Vågerosions-försök (21), Jordstat beräkn etc (26, 29, övers t tyska), Tryckförluster i skyddsgrindar (27), Utredn betr avbördn.förhåll v regl.dammen v Vargön (tills m E Lindquist 33), Ekon probl inom vattenbyggn.tekn (43). KVO2kl, RNO, KDDO2gr, RNSrtOOlkl.
translated: FELLENIUS, Wolmar Knut Axel, Professor emeritus, Lieutenant Colonel, Stockholm, from Salem, Stockholm County, born on September 10th, 1876, son of Major A R W F and Eveline Kuhlau, married to Emy Janse. Previously employed at the National Real Estate Board in Stockholm from 1894 and at the Royal Institute of Technology (V & V) from 1894 to 1898. Took military courses for entry into military service in 1898, became a second lieutenant in 1904, lieutenant in 1913, major in 1920, and lieutenant colonel in 1930. Worked as a civil engineer for the state railways from Gällivare to Riksgränsen in 1899, as an assistant engineer for the construction office in Norrköping from 1899 to 1903, as a surveyor and city engineer in Härnösand from 1903 to 1905, as head of the new construction division of the Gothenburg Harbour Board from 1905 to 1911, as a lecturer in highway and water engineering at the Central Technical Laboratory from 1906 to 1911, and as a professor in hydraulic engineering at the Royal Institute of Technology from 1911 to 1942. Served in military training in 1914, 1939, 1940, and was released in 1941. Responsible for the proposals for the construction of harbors in Gothenburg, Västerås, Falkenberg, Kristinehamn, Jönköping, Södertälje, Oskarshamn, Örnsköldsvik, Halmstad, Helsingborg, Gävle, Varberg, Landskrona, Trondheim, Oslo, and others, as well as assisting in the implementation of these proposals. Managed and supervised the construction of a pontoon bridge over Tranebergssund (together with Professor O Linton in 1913) and conducted investigations for a floating bridge over Lilla Värtan (also with Linton). Led the commission for the state railways from Rönninge to Ström in 1911, served as a geotechnical commissioner for the Swedish Railways, served as chairman from 1919 to 1922 and chairman of the working committee from 1914 to 1922. Headed the division of highway and water engineering at the Royal Institute of Technology from 1915 to 1928 and from 1939 to 1942, chairman of the KTH Library Committee from 1933 to 1942. Secretary of the Swedish Municipal Technology Association from 1908 to 1912, honorary member since 1933, honorary citizen of the Karlsruhe University of Technology in 1921, corresponding member of the Norwegian Engineering Association in 1924, Honorary Doctor of Technical University of Darmstadt in 1936, member of the Swedish Engineering Association Board from 1923 to 1925, 1928 to 1929, and 1931 to 1936, chairman of the technical education division from 1923 to 1925, and 1933 to 1936, chairman of the highway and water engineering division in 1926 and 1927, chairman of the Johannes Division of the Stockholm Property Owners Association since 1935, deputy chairman of its delegation since 1937, member of the rental committee for the 5th district of Stockholm since 1942, member of the study council of the Technical Institute in Stockholm since 1916, chairman of the Men of 1876 association since 1931. Published works: "Fishing harbors at or near the North Sea" (1907), "Free ports in Europe, Calculation of quay construction, etc." (1910), "New construction in the Gothenburg Harbor" (1912), "Development of harbor traffic in Sweden during the past 50 years" (1912), "Proposal for a free port in Gothenburg" (1915), Investigation of erosion risks through partial regulation of Lake Siljan (together with L. von Post in 1922), Economic calculation of pump pipelines (1913), Hydraulic Engineering Laboratory at KTH (1919, 1922, 1926, 1929), Wave erosion experiments (1921), Calculation of soil statistics, etc. (1926, 1929, translated into German), Pressure losses in protective gates (1927), Investigation of drainage aspects of the regulation dam in Vargön (together with E. Lindquist in 1933), Economic problems in water engineering (1943). Knight of the Royal Order of the Polar Star, Order of the North Star, Commander of the Order of Vasa, and Knight of the Order of the Sword.
